cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north-northeast, cross the Florida Gulf coast Thursday, track across Georgia/South Carolina and then move offshore of the North Carolina coast toward the open western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River FL to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch: west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, then the coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Chance (≤17%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Friday into early Saturday; strongest gusts likely below 50 kt threshold
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected for Wilmington under current forecast track
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could deliver 2–4 inches with isolated higher pockets, producing localized ponding and minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along southeast North Carolina beaches
